statement:
Let ${\mathord{\mathbf{Haus}}}$ be the category of locally compact
Hausdorff spaces with continuous proper maps as morphisms. And, let
${\mathord{\mathbf{C^*Alg}}}$ be the category of commutative
$C^*$-algebras with proper \*-homomorphisms (send approximate units into
approximate units) as morphisms. There is a contravariant functor
$C\colon {\mathord{\mathbf{Haus}}}^{\mathrm{op}}\to {\mathord{\mathbf{C^*Alg}}}$
which sends each locally compact Hausdorff space $X$ to the commutative
$C^*$-algebra $C_0(X)$ ($C(X)$ if $X$ is compact). Conversely, there is
a contravariant functor
$M\colon {\mathord{\mathbf{C^*Alg}}}^{\mathrm{op}}\to {\mathord{\mathbf{Haus}}}$
which sends each commutative $C^*$-algebra $A$ to the space of
characters on $A$ (with the Gelfand topology).

The functors $C$ and $M$ are an equivalence of categories.
